## hpr2555 :: 2017-2018 New Years Eve show part 6

 HPR NYE 2017 - 6

Using Ubuntu with snaps or just using Debian for a home server
Building a home firewall
What is the best firewall distro
Maybe just learn ip tables
Fun with virtualization
https://riscv.org/
A completely Free Hardware CPU that is gaining press
https://www.xilinx.com/products/silicon-devices/soc/zynq-7000.html
An ARM processor with built-in FPGA
Western Digital moving to RISC-V:
https://www.forbes.com/sites/tiriasresearch/2017/12/06/western-digital-gives-a-billion-unit-boost-to-open-source-risc-v-cpu/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ATZls4lbwmM&t=20m27s
WD CEO announces their ambition to switch fully to RISC-V
https://www.heropunch.io/
Creating free hardware for decentralized communications, mobile applications and mesh networks
https://www.scuttlebutt.nz/
Secure Scuttlebutt, or SSB, is built for intermittent networks and drop points
A little bit about https://ipfs.io/
Content-Addressable Networks are important if you're in intermittent or high-latency mesh networks
And in passing: https://twister.net.co/
BitTorrent + blockchain + DHT social networking, not entirely dissimilar to SSB
https://www.bitmessage.org/
clacke was wrong, it doesn't store messages in a blockchain
3D printers: https://podnutz.com/category/themakerz/

podcast https://www.tinkercad.com/
cloud CAD https://www.autodesk.com/products/fusion-360/overview
cloud CAD https://www.onshape.com/
cloud CAD https://www.thingiverse.com/
"the Facebook of 3D model sharing" https://cults3d.com/
3D model sharing
https://www.cnx-software.com/2017/05/25/melon-s3-fpga-arduino-raspberry-pi-compatible-board-is-programmable-over-wifi-using-esp8266-wisoc/

https://www.cnx-software.com/2015/11/24/fleafpga-uno-board-combines-a-lattice-fpga-arduino-uno-form-factor-hdmi-output-and-an-esp8266-wifi-module/
Amiga and https://www.morphos-team.net/
MorphOS is a proprietary implementation of AmigaOS for PowerPC, but uses free software components from e.g. AROS
https://c64upgra.de/c-one/
A C64 reimplementation project that turned into an FPGA platform that can even act as an Amiga
Ken is awake and is going to solder
Netminer mentions https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCu4uiUtALy1ILAxNh7TGsmQ
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHthWtKWXJE

Ken suggest a show on Bitscope + Raspberry Pi + aurduino tutorial series
